intro: Stomarrhena xerophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stromboid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in whorls, and are usually pink or purple in color. Stomarrhena xerophylla has adapted to thrive in humid climates with high rainfall.
